intro: Palicourea valeriana, commonly known as Brazilian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and has a woody stem that becomes more pronounced with age. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Palicourea valeriana is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some species in the genus being used in traditional medicine.
